question_text: A technician installs an RJ45 connector but finds that the copper contacts did not pierce through the insulation of all wires. What was most likely done incorrectly?
answer_options: The cable tester was not calibrated
The wires were stripped too far
The crimping tool was not fully engaged
A punchdown tool was used instead of a crimper
correct_answer: The crimping tool was not fully engaged
explanation: If the crimping tool is not fully engaged, the metal contacts in the connector may not pierce the wire insulation, leading to failed connections.
